params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which chain to bridge assets onto
params.to: address on other chain to bridge assets to

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

mint(address,address,uint256,uint256).details: This means the BridgeDeposit.sol contract must have minter access to the token attempting to be minted

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain post-fees
params.fee: Amount in native token decimals to save to the contract as fees*
params.to: address on other chain to redeem underlying assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to transfer cross-chain pre-fees*
params.chainId: which underlying chain to bridge assets onto
params.to: address on other chain to redeem underlying assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to deposit into the bridge

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role.

params.amount: Amount in native token decimals to withdraw
params.fee: Amount in native token decimals to save to the contract as fees*
params.to: address on chain to send underlying assets to
params.token: ERC20 compatible token to withdraw from the bridge

params.amount: Amount in gas token decimals to withdraw (after subtracting fee already)
params.fee: Amount in gas token decimals to save to the contract as fees*
params.to: address on chain to send gas asset to
Address to send the gas fees to
Address to send the fees to
params.token: ERC20 token in which fees acccumulated to transfer

deposit(address,uint256,address,uint256).notice: Relays to nodes to transfers an ERC20 token cross-chain

depositETH(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Relays to nodes to transfers the underlying chain gas token cross-chain

mint(address,address,uint256,uint256).notice: Relays to nodes that (typically) a wrapped synAsset ERC20 token has been burned and the underlying needs to be redeeemed on the native chain

redeem(address,uint256,address,uint256).notice: Relays to nodes that (typically) a wrapped synAsset ERC20 token has been burned and the underlying needs to be redeeemed on the native chain

withdraw(address,address,uint256,uint256.notice: Function to be called by the node group to withdraw the underlying assets from the contract

withdrawETH(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Function to be called by the node group to withdraw the underlying gas asset from the contract

withdrawETHAdminFees(address).notice: withdraw gas token fees to a given address

withdrawFees(address,address).notice: withdraw specified ERC20 token fees to a given address
